column3: I heard these words ringing out from a room so crowded with people that I could but just see the auctioneer's face and uplifted hammer above the heads of the crowd."Going! Going! Going! Gone!" and down came the hammer with a sharp rap.I do not know how or why it was
column4: but the words struck me with a new force and significance. I had heard them hundreds of times before
column5: with only a sense of amusement. This time they sounded solemn."Going! Going! Gone!""That is the way it is with life
column6: I said to myself - with time." This world is a sort of auction room; we do not know that we are buyers: we are
column8: more like beggars; we have brought no money to exchange for precious minutes
